description: Triangle T(m,n) giving of number of steps in the Euclidean algorithm for GCD(m,n) with 0<=m<n.
links: T. D. Noe, Rows n=1..100 of triangle, flattened
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Euclidean Algorithm.
mathematica: t[m_, n_] := For[r[-1]=m; r[0]=n; k=1, True, k++, r[k] = Mod[r[k-2], r[k-1]]; If[r[k] == 0, Return[k-1]]]; Table[ t[m, n] , {n, 1, 14}, {m, 0, n-1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Oct 25 2012 *)
prog: (Haskell)a051010 n k = snd $ until ((== 0) . snd . fst)                    (\((x, y), i) -> ((y, mod x y), i + 1)) ((n, k), 0)a051010_row n = map (a051010 n) [0..n-1]a051010_tabl = map a051010_row [1..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 27 2013
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
